text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I'm going to
show you how to make super simple three
color salad with a creamy balsamic
vinaigrette here's what you need a large
head of green leaf lettuce that I've
already washed and chopped you need a
small head of radicchio choose small
heads of endive salt and pepper Dijon
mustard extra virgin olive oil and
balsamic vinegar okay let's get shopping
now I've already washed and dried and
cut my green leaf lettuce okay now I'm
just going to chop my radicchio radhika
comes already washed all have to do is
chop it get the core out because it's
not very tasty okay and I'm going to
just cut it in big chunks I call this my
Italian salad just because I feel like I
has the same colors at the time frags
like red one green can't go wrong and
dies next now endive and radicchio is
kind of they're kind of really bitter so
what I do is I parry with the green leaf
lettuce which is really a buttery and
then the creamy balsamic vinaigrette
complements it really really well okay
just take out the hard core because
that's not very tasty just separate your
leaves like that part here you go last
of my endive going in okay just going to
mix it with my hands clean hands always
a cook's best tool okay okay a little
spillage that's okay now I'm gonna make
the vinaigrette you need about a
teaspoon of Dijon mustard this is just
to emulsify the vinaigrette so it stays
nice and creamy okay you need a bow two
to three tablespoons of balsamic vinegar
that's perfect
seong pepper you've been a grip okay
give this a little whisk and then stream
in the extra-virgin olive oil about 1/4
cup or so almost there there you go okay
Dijon mustard really makes a dressing
creamy and slightly sweet just poured
this over your salad you want to do this
right before you serve it just because
the balsamic vinegar tends to wilt down
the acidity of it touch the ball down
your greens okay take your serving
utensils give this a little mix and you
get to go here you have it guys
super simple salad with just a handful
of ingredients it's easy it's a light
it's delicious and I hope you've enjoyed
spending time with me because I've
definitely enjoyed spending time in you
to get this recipe more recipes visit my

now see you next time
